com.emmes.aps.sync

Class DataSyncRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • android.app.IntentService
            • com.emmes.aps.sync.DataSyncRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2

    public class DataSyncRequest
extends android.app.IntentService
    The Class DataSyncRequest IntentService is an IntentService which accumulate all the transferable data from the application and transfer them to the server working background. This also collections settings that has been changed or updated to the server for example, tracking duration setup.

    Outbound data: The APS application have four different types of data to be transfered to the server.

    • Diary Data:The main diary data are collected for the diary page itself from the database.
    • Medication Data:The secondary medication data is the selected list of prescribed medications by the patient each day.
    • Supplement Data:The secondary supplement data is the selected list of supplement or other medication by the patient each day.
    • Location Data:The precise GPS location data is being captured by the application if user give the consent and if the current time fall inside the tracking duration set from the server side.
    • Peakflow Data:The peak flow data is the three different data points or measured data each day.
    • Settings Data:User settings which are stored as sharedpreference may be send to the server. This is not implemented here yet.
    Inbound data: The APS application have some control that will be set later after providing the patient with the smart device and application. Some settings will always be changed.
    • Form content settings:The form content or local settings of the application for different types of data will be updated later from the server side.
      Form name Frequency Start window End Window Last collected time
      Diary 1 00:00 23:59 2014-07-23 13:00:00
      Nitro 2 16:00 20:00 2014-07-23 13:00:00
      AM_PEAK 1 8:00 10:00 2014-07-23 13:00:00
      PM_PEAK 1 16:00 20:00 2014-07-23 13:00:00
    • Tracking duration Data:For tracking the location of the user, the system asked for consent and also there is start time and end time and that will also be decided later. So this type of data should be downloaded from server to application. The tracking duration could be more than once.

    This service start the process of of collecting data,send these to server, create broadcast request for tracking the response, process the response and if anything new, store them to the local database tables.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mahbubur Rahman *
    See Also:
    IntentService, ContextWrapper.sendBroadcast(Intent intent), Gson, ArrayList, HttpPost, ContentResolver

      private com.google.gson.JsonObject createJSONDataToTransfer()
      This createJSONDataToTransfer method calls DataSyncRequest.sync for location and transform it to JSON object, calls DataSyncRequest.sync for diary and covert to diary JSON object, call DataSyncRequest.sync for peak flow and convert to peak flow object, cakks DataSyncRequest.sync for medication and supplement and convert it to medication JSON object.

      • getTrasferrableData

        private void getTrasferrableData()
        This getTrasferrableData method set the servlet and collect data from the local database to be sent to the server. This method call createJSONDataToTransfer() to get all accumulated data into a single JSON object.
        Parameters:
        none -
        Throws:
        none
        Since:
        1.0

      • createJSONDataToTransfer

        private com.google.gson.JsonObject createJSONDataToTransfer()
        This createJSONDataToTransfer method calls DataSyncRequest.sync for location and transform it to JSON object, calls DataSyncRequest.sync for diary and covert to diary JSON object, call DataSyncRequest.sync for peak flow and convert to peak flow object, cakks DataSyncRequest.sync for medication and supplement and convert it to medication JSON object. Finally all are integrated to single JSON object.
        Parameters:
        none -
        Returns:
        jO- a single JsonObject containing all types of information that has to be sent to the server.
        Throws:
        none
        Since:
        1.0

      • retrieveMedicationDataFromDB

        private java.util.ArrayList<MedicationDataFormat> retrieveMedicationDataFromDB()
        This retrieveMedicationDataFromDB() method retrieve Medication data which are ready to be transfered to server. This is determined by observing the status of data. If some data failed previously to transfer because of network or other server related problem, then this will also be included . So finally it will retrieve data with status READY or IN_QUEUE or data entered earliar than today .
        Parameters:
        none -
        Returns:
        the array list of type of com.emmes.aps.sync
        Throws:
        none
        Since:
        1.0

If some data failed previously to transfer because of network or other server related problem, then this will also be included . So finally it will retrieve data with status READY and IN_QUEUE .
